comments.author: Kagreiss
comments.body: I believe someone installed this on my device and I don't know how to remove

comments.author: IISResetMe
comments.body:
@Kagreiss Is the issue that you have PowerShell installed on your computer? Windows comes with a previous version of PowerShell installed out of the box, so if you're on Windows and find an installation of Windows PowerShell, that's completely expected.

Please share details about which operating system and version you're on and what exactly it is that you believe has been installed :)

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
No security issue reported.  This may or may not be a security problem is the customer's environment, but not PowerShell itself.

Also, the customer reported a "security issue" in violation of our Code of Conduct and explicit instructions in the security issues template.  Consider this a warning.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body:
I recommend re-filing with the Bug report template.  It tries to gather what is needed to answer this type of question.
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/new?assignees=&labels=Issue-Question&template=Bug_Report.md&title=My+bug+report
